body.p: Based on the results of a nationwide study, the number of contacts programmed into cell phones are summarized on the following boxplot:
Choose the correct label for the point on the boxplot represented by the question mark:

response.feedback: Incorrect. The minimum is the smallest observation, which is represented on the far left by the end of the whisker, located at 25.
Incorrect. The first quartile (Q1) is the median of the bottom half of the data, and is represented on the boxplot by the left side of the box, located at 50.
Incorrect. The median is the middle value of all the observations, and is represented on the boxplot by the line in the center of the box, located at 75.
Correct. The third quartile (Q3) is the median of the top half of the data, and is represented on the boxplot by the right side of the box, located at 125.
Incorrect. The maximum is the largest observation, which is represented on the far right by the end of the whisker, located at 200.

body.p: The cost of taking your pet aboard the air flight with you in the continental US varies according to the airlines. The five number summary for prices based on a sample of major US airlines was:
If we were to build the box plot for this data, the box would stretch between which two values?
What would be the lowest value: and highest value:

response.feedback: Incorrect. The minimum is 60, which is not the lowest value (left side, bottom of the box) in a boxplot. The minimum is represented on the far left (or bottom) by the end of the whisker.
Correct. The lowest value (left side, bottom of the box) in a boxplot is the first quartile, which in this data set is 100.
Incorrect. The lowest value (left side, bottom of the box) in a boxplot is not the median, but rather the value representing the 25th percentile of the distribution.
Incorrect. The lowest value (left side, bottom of the box) in a boxplot is not the third quartile.
Incorrect. The lowest value (left side, bottom of the box) in a boxplot is not the maximum, but rather the value representing the 25th percentile of the distribution.
Incorrect. The minimum is 60, which is not the highest value (right side, top of the box) in a boxplot. The minimum is represented on the far left (or bottom) by the end of the whisker.
Incorrect. The highest value (right side side, top of the box) in a boxplot is not the first quartile.
Incorrect. The highest value (right side side, top of the box) in a boxplot is not the median, but rather the value representing the 75th percentile of the distribution.
Correct. The highest value (right side side, top of the box) in a boxplot is the third quartile, which is this data set is 125.

Incorrect. The highest value (right side side, top of the box) in a boxplot is not the maximum, but rather the value representing the 75th percentile of the distribution. The maximum is represented on the far right (or top) by the end of the whisker.
